required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Exercise for Treatment of Depression and Anxiety - RCT
clinical_study.official_title: Physical Activity as Treatment for Depression and Anxiety Towards Affordable Preventive Healthcare - a Randomised Controlled Study (RCT)

brief_summary.textblock: In a 12 week randomly controlled open trial 102 participants with symptoms of depression and/or anxiety will be exposed to either aerobic high intensity training (HIT) or relaxation therapy. Cognitive functions, biomarkers, psychiatric symptom scales and physical status will be collected at baseline, after 12 weeks and after a year. Depression and anxiety will be measured twice during the intervention period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 60 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 60 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 63 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 63 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale Self-Rating Version (MADRS-S). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 60 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of the score from the baseline to the score at 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of symptom severity grade are assessed with Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale Self-Rating Version (MADRS-S). The minimum and the maximum score is 0 and 60 respectively, and the higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function: Trail Making Test Part A&B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Comparison of results between baseline and week 12.
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive functions are measured using digitized cognitive tests selected for depression in cooperation with Mindmore.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function: Trail Making Test Part A&B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Comparison of results between baseline and year 1.
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive functions are measured using digitized cognitive tests selected for depression in cooperation with Mindmore.

secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive functions are measured using digitized cognitive tests selected for depression in cooperation with Mindmore.
The fecal samples will be analyzed for biomarkers of microbial composition, inflammation and gut barrier function using 16S microbiota analysis, metabolomics and Next Generation Sequencing.
The inflammatory biomarkers will be analyzed using ELISA and Luminex.
A fatty acid profile in the serum or plasma will be analyzed using gas chromatography coupled to mass spectrometry.

other_outcome.description: Clinician's impression of total severity of the mental illness. Scale between 0 and 7, higher point indicates worse outcome.
Measures symptoms in posttraumatic stress disorder. Total points 0-80, higher point indicates worse outcome.
Measures symptoms in attention deficiency and hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Higher point indicates worse outcome.
Measures perceived stress. Higher point indicates worse outcome.
Assesses the current overall health related to wellbeing and function experienced by the patient.

arm_group.description: 45 minutes of aerobic, high intensity group training, three times per week during a 12-week period.
45 minutes of relaxation therapy once per week for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Score ≥12 on MADRS or score ≥16 on BAI
- Inhabitant i Örebro County, Sweden
- BMI ≥18 kg/m^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of chronic psychotic disease or ongoing psychotic episode.
- Ongoing manic state of bipolar disorder
- Severe somatic disease or condition where high intensity exercise is contraindicated
- Difficulty with reading, hearing or understanding the Swedish language

facility.name: Department of Psychiatry, University hospital Örebro

reference.citation: Björngrim S, van den Hurk W, Betancort M, Machado A, Lindau M. Comparing Traditional and Digitized Cognitive Tests Used in Standard Clinical Evaluation - A Study of the Digital Application Minnemera. Front Psychol. 2019 Oct 18;10:2327. doi: 10.3389/fpsyg.2019.02327. eCollection 2019.
